definition: lit. to meet those arriving, to send of those departing (idiom); busy entertaining guests/all time taken over with social niceties
to welcome/to meet/to face/to forge ahead (esp. in the face of difficulties)
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
to deliver/to carry/to give (as a present)/to present (with)/to see off/to send
old variant of 往[wang3]
to go (in a direction)/to/towards/(of a train) bound for/past/previous

sentences.english: How time flies! While welcoming the new year and saying goodbye to the past year, we become one year older.
sentences.chinese: 时间真快，在迎来送往中我们不经意又长了一岁。

definition: see 迎來送往|迎来送往[ying2 lai2 song4 wang3]
guests filled the hall (idiom); a house full of distinguished visitors
lit. peddlers and carriers/common people/lower class
wine goblets and gambling chips lie intertwined/to drink and gamble together in a large group (idiom)/a big (drinking) party
to be busy rushing about/to bustle about
social niceties/social interaction/a dinner party
the stream flows without stopping (idiom); unending flow
to come and go/to have dealings with/to be in relation with

the Three Religions (Daoism, Confucianism, Buddhism) and Nine Schools (Confucians, Daoists, Yin-Yang, Legalists, Logicians, Mohists, Political Strategists, Eclectics, Agriculturists)/fig. people from all trades (often derog.)
to receive (a visitor)/to admit (allow sb to enter)
young people decked out in gorgeous clothes (idiom)
to visit frequently/to have frequent dealings (with)/to see each other often
endless stream of horse and carriages (idiom)/heavy traffic
restless
dealings/contacts/to go back and forth
high official and noble persons (idiom); the great and the good
